column4: hi all! Can someone tell me how i prevent my ATI to turn on on boot on ubuntu 10.10?
only the drivers, or the entire card?
oh, sorry, then I can't help you ;)
but, if you find out, I'd like to know as well, having an 5700 in my laptop ;)
I believe you can make an initscript that runs on shutdown
and unloading modules wont stop it from turning on, AFAIK
maybe unloading the modules does solve the 'not shutting down' problem though...
you're not using ATI setup in your xorg.conf (if any), are you?
you know which modules to unload?
hmm, correct me if i'm wrong, but I believe you need to disable fglrx as well
ok, that is good
radeonfb?
well, fb stands for framebuffer, don't know the details actually
just running some searches on the available modules ;)
sudo modprobe -l | grep -i ati
that's too bad...
does it indeed run on the intel GPU? or is it running VESA?
/etc/acpi/something
no wait, that's the powerbutton
http://synapse.wordpress.com/2007/03/24/run-a-script-on-startup-shutdown-in-linux/
good luck ^^
